content: 1 Paul, bondman of Jesus Christ, a called apostle, separated to God’s glad tidings,
content_old: 1 Paul, bondman of Jesus Christ, a called apostle, separated to God’s glad tidings,

content: 2 (which he had before promised by his prophets in holy writings,)
content_old: 2 (which he had before promised by his prophets in holy writings,)

content: 3 concerning his Son (come of David’s seed according to flesh,
content_old: 3 concerning his Son (come of David’s seed according to flesh,

content: 4 marked out Son of God in power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by resurrection of the dead) Jesus Christ our Lord;
content_old: 4 marked out Son of God in power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by resurrection of the dead) Jesus Christ our Lord;

content: 5 by whom we have received grace and apostleship in behalf of his name, for obedience of faith among all the nations,
content_old: 5 by whom we have received grace and apostleship in behalf of his name, for obedience of faith among all the nations,

content: 6 among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:
content_old: 6 among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

content: 7 to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 7 to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 8 First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is proclaimed in the whole world.
content_old: 8 First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is proclaimed in the whole world.

content: 9 For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the glad tidings of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you,
content_old: 9 For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the glad tidings of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you,

content: 10 always beseeching at my prayers, if any way now at least I may be prospered by the will of God to come to you.
content_old: 10 always beseeching at my prayers, if any way now at least I may be prospered by the will of God to come to you.

content: 11 For I greatly desire to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to establish you;
content_old: 11 For I greatly desire to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to establish you;

content: 12 that is, to have mutual comfort among you, each by the faith which is in the other, both yours and mine.
content_old: 12 that is, to have mutual comfort among you, each by the faith which is in the other, both yours and mine.

content: 13 But I do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, that I often proposed to come to you, (and have been hindered until the present time,) that I might have some fruit among you too, even as among the other nations also.
content_old: 13 But I do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, that I often proposed to come to you, (and have been hindered until the present time,) that I might have some fruit among you too, even as among the other nations also.

content: 14 I am a debtor both to Greeks and barbarians, both to wise and unintelligent:
content_old: 14 I am a debtor both to Greeks and barbarians, both to wise and unintelligent:

content: 15 so, as far as depends on me, am I ready to announce the glad tidings to you also who are in Rome.
content_old: 15 so, as far as depends on me, am I ready to announce the glad tidings to you also who are in Rome.

content: 16 For I am not ashamed of the glad tidings; for it is God’s power to salvation, to every one that believes, both to Jew first and to Greek:
content_old: 16 For I am not ashamed of the glad tidings; for it is God’s power to salvation, to every one that believes, both to Jew first and to Greek:

content: 17 for righteousness of God is revealed therein, on the principle of faith, to faith: according as it is written, But the just shall live by faith.
content_old: 17 for righteousness of God is revealed therein, on the principle of faith, to faith: according as it is written, But the just shall live by faith.

content: 18 For there is revealed wrath of God from heaven upon all impiety, and unrighteousness of men holding the truth in unrighteousness.
content_old: 18 For there is revealed wrath of God from heaven upon all impiety, and unrighteousness of men holding the truth in unrighteousness.

content: 19 Because what is known of God is manifest among them, for God has manifested it to them,
content_old: 19 Because what is known of God is manifest among them, for God has manifested it to them,

content: 20 —for from the world’s creation the invisible things of him are perceived, being apprehended by the mind through the things that are made, both his eternal power and divinity, —so as to render them inexcusable.
content_old: 20 —for from the world’s creation the invisible things of him are perceived, being apprehended by the mind through the things that are made, both his eternal power and divinity, —so as to render them inexcusable.

content: 21 Because, knowing God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but fell into folly in their thoughts, and their heart without understanding was darkened:
content_old: 21 Because, knowing God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but fell into folly in their thoughts, and their heart without understanding was darkened:

content: 22 professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,
content_old: 22 professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

content: 23 and changed the glory of the incorruptible God into the likeness of an image of corruptible man and of birds and quadrupeds and reptiles.
content_old: 23 and changed the glory of the incorruptible God into the likeness of an image of corruptible man and of birds and quadrupeds and reptiles.

content: 24 Wherefore God gave them up also in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness, to dishonour their bodies between themselves:
content_old: 24 Wherefore God gave them up also in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness, to dishonour their bodies between themselves:

content: 25 who changed the truth of God into falsehood, and honoured and served the creature more than him who had created it, who is blessed for ever. Amen.
content_old: 25 who changed the truth of God into falsehood, and honoured and served the creature more than him who had created it, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

content: 26 For this reason God gave them up to vile lusts; for both their females changed the natural use into that contrary to nature;
content_old: 26 For this reason God gave them up to vile lusts; for both their females changed the natural use into that contrary to nature;

content: 27 and in like manner the males also, leaving the natural use of the female, were inflamed in their lust towards one another; males with males working shame, and receiving in themselves the recompense of their error which was fit.
content_old: 27 and in like manner the males also, leaving the natural use of the female, were inflamed in their lust towards one another; males with males working shame, and receiving in themselves the recompense of their error which was fit.

content: 28 And according as they did not think good to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up to a reprobate mind to practise unseemly things;
content_old: 28 And according as they did not think good to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up to a reprobate mind to practise unseemly things;

content: 29 being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, malice; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil dispositions; whisperers,
content_old: 29 being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, malice; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil dispositions; whisperers,

content: 30 back-biters, hateful to God, insolent, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,
content_old: 30 back-biters, hateful to God, insolent, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

content: 31 void of understanding, faithless, without natural affection, unmerciful;
content_old: 31 void of understanding, faithless, without natural affection, unmerciful;

content: 1 Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, every one who judgest, for in that in which thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.
content_old: 1 Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, every one who judgest, for in that in which thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

content: 2 But we know that the judgment of God is according to truth upon those who do such things.
content_old: 2 But we know that the judgment of God is according to truth upon those who do such things.

content: 3 And thinkest thou this, O man, who judgest those that do such things, and practisest them thyself, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?
content_old: 3 And thinkest thou this, O man, who judgest those that do such things, and practisest them thyself, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

content: 4 or despisest thou the riches of his goodness, and forbearance, and long-suffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?
content_old: 4 or despisest thou the riches of his goodness, and forbearance, and long-suffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?

content: 5 but, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, treasurest up to thyself wrath, in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,
content_old: 5 but, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, treasurest up to thyself wrath, in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,

content: 6 who shall render to each according to his works:
content_old: 6 who shall render to each according to his works:

content: 7 to them who, in patient continuance of good works, seek for glory and honour and incorruptibility, life eternal.
content_old: 7 to them who, in patient continuance of good works, seek for glory and honour and incorruptibility, life eternal.

content: 8 But to those that are contentious, and are disobedient to the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there shall be wrath and indignation,
content_old: 8 But to those that are contentious, and are disobedient to the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there shall be wrath and indignation,

content: 9 tribulation and distress, on every soul of man that works evil, both of Jew first, and of Greek;
content_old: 9 tribulation and distress, on every soul of man that works evil, both of Jew first, and of Greek;

content: 10 but glory and honour and peace to every one that works good, both to Jew first and to Greek:
content_old: 10 but glory and honour and peace to every one that works good, both to Jew first and to Greek:

content: 11 for there is no acceptance of persons with God.
content_old: 11 for there is no acceptance of persons with God.

content: 12 For as many as have sinned without law shall perish also without law; and as many as have sinned under law shall be judged by law,
content_old: 12 For as many as have sinned without law shall perish also without law; and as many as have sinned under law shall be judged by law,

content: 13 (for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.
content_old: 13 (for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

content: 14 For when those of the nations, which have no law, practise by nature the things of the law, these, having no law, are a law to themselves;
content_old: 14 For when those of the nations, which have no law, practise by nature the things of the law, these, having no law, are a law to themselves;

content: 15 who shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts accusing or else excusing themselves between themselves;)
content_old: 15 who shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts accusing or else excusing themselves between themselves;)

content: 16 in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my glad tidings, by Jesus Christ.
content_old: 16 in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my glad tidings, by Jesus Christ.

content: 17 But if thou art named a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast in God,
content_old: 17 But if thou art named a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast in God,

content: 18 and knowest the will, and discerningly approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;
content_old: 18 and knowest the will, and discerningly approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

content: 19 and hast confidence that thou thyself art a leader of the blind, a light of those who are in darkness,
content_old: 19 and hast confidence that thou thyself art a leader of the blind, a light of those who are in darkness,

content: 20 an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:
content_old: 20 an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:

content: 21 thou then that teachest another, dost thou not teach thyself? thou that preachest not to steal, dost thou steal?
content_old: 21 thou then that teachest another, dost thou not teach thyself? thou that preachest not to steal, dost thou steal?

content: 22 thou that sayest man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?
content_old: 22 thou that sayest man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?

content: 23 thou who boastest in law, dost thou by transgression of the law dishonour God?
content_old: 23 thou who boastest in law, dost thou by transgression of the law dishonour God?

content: 24 For the name of God is blasphemed on your account among the nations, according as it is written.
content_old: 24 For the name of God is blasphemed on your account among the nations, according as it is written.

content: 25 For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep the law; but if thou be a law-transgressor, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.
content_old: 25 For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep the law; but if thou be a law-transgressor, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.

content: 26 If therefore the uncircumcision keep the requirements of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision,
content_old: 26 If therefore the uncircumcision keep the requirements of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision,

content: 27 and uncircumcision by nature, fulfilling the law, judge thee, who, with letter and circumcision, art a law-transgressor?
content_old: 27 and uncircumcision by nature, fulfilling the law, judge thee, who, with letter and circumcision, art a law-transgressor?

content: 28 For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither that circumcision which is outward in flesh;
content_old: 28 For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither that circumcision which is outward in flesh;

content: 1 What then is the superiority of the Jew? or what the profit of circumcision?
content_old: 1 What then is the superiority of the Jew? or what the profit of circumcision?

content: 2 Much every way: and first, indeed, that to them were entrusted the oracles of God.
content_old: 2 Much every way: and first, indeed, that to them were entrusted the oracles of God.

content: 3 For what? if some have not believed, shall their unbelief make the faith of God of none effect?
content_old: 3 For what? if some have not believed, shall their unbelief make the faith of God of none effect?

content: 4 Far be the thought: but let God be true, and every man false; according as it is written, So that thou shouldest be justified in thy words, and shouldest overcome when thou art in judgment.
content_old: 4 Far be the thought: but let God be true, and every man false; according as it is written, So that thou shouldest be justified in thy words, and shouldest overcome when thou art in judgment.

content: 5 But if our unrighteousness commend God’s righteousness, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak according to man.
content_old: 5 But if our unrighteousness commend God’s righteousness, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak according to man.

content: 6 Far be the thought: since how shall God judge the world?
content_old: 6 Far be the thought: since how shall God judge the world?

content: 7 For if the truth of God, in my lie, has more abounded to his glory, why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
content_old: 7 For if the truth of God, in my lie, has more abounded to his glory, why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

content: 8 and not, according as we are injuriously charged, and according as some affirm that we say, Let us practise evil things, that good ones may come? whose judgment is just.
content_old: 8 and not, according as we are injuriously charged, and according as some affirm that we say, Let us practise evil things, that good ones may come? whose judgment is just.

content: 9 What then? are we better? No, in no wise: for we have before charged both Jews and Greeks with being all under sin:
content_old: 9 What then? are we better? No, in no wise: for we have before charged both Jews and Greeks with being all under sin:

content: 10 according as it is written, There is not a righteous man, not even one;
content_old: 10 according as it is written, There is not a righteous man, not even one;

content: 11 there is not the man that understands, there is not one that seeks after God.
content_old: 11 there is not the man that understands, there is not one that seeks after God.

content: 12 All have gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable; there is not one that practises goodness, there is not so much as one:
content_old: 12 All have gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable; there is not one that practises goodness, there is not so much as one:

content: 13 their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; asps’ poison is under their lips:
content_old: 13 their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; asps’ poison is under their lips:

content: 14 whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness;
content_old: 14 whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness;

content: 15 swift their feet to shed blood;
content_old: 15 swift their feet to shed blood;

content: 16 ruin and misery are in their ways,
content_old: 16 ruin and misery are in their ways,

content: 17 and way of peace they have not known:
content_old: 17 and way of peace they have not known:

content: 18 there is no fear of God before their eyes.
content_old: 18 there is no fear of God before their eyes.

content: 19 Now we know that whatever the things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world be under judgment to God.
content_old: 19 Now we know that whatever the things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world be under judgment to God.

content: 20 Wherefore by works of law no flesh shall be justified before him; for by law is knowledge of sin.
content_old: 20 Wherefore by works of law no flesh shall be justified before him; for by law is knowledge of sin.

content: 21 But now without law righteousness of God is manifested, borne witness to by the law and the prophets;
content_old: 21 But now without law righteousness of God is manifested, borne witness to by the law and the prophets;

content: 22 righteousness of God by faith of Jesus Christ towards all, and upon all those who believe: for there is no difference;
content_old: 22 righteousness of God by faith of Jesus Christ towards all, and upon all those who believe: for there is no difference;

content: 23 for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
content_old: 23 for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

content: 24 being justified freely by his grace through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus;
content_old: 24 being justified freely by his grace through the redemption which is in Christ Jesus;

content: 25 whom God has set forth a mercy-seat, through faith in his blood, for the shewing forth of his righteousness, in respect of the passing by the sins that had taken place before, through the forbearance of God;
content_old: 25 whom God has set forth a mercy-seat, through faith in his blood, for the shewing forth of his righteousness, in respect of the passing by the sins that had taken place before, through the forbearance of God;

content: 26 for the shewing forth of his righteousness in the present time, so that he should be just, and justify him that is of the faith of Jesus.
content_old: 26 for the shewing forth of his righteousness in the present time, so that he should be just, and justify him that is of the faith of Jesus.

content: 27 Where then is boasting? It has been excluded. By what law? of works? Nay, but by law of faith;
content_old: 27 Where then is boasting? It has been excluded. By what law? of works? Nay, but by law of faith;

content: 28 for we reckon that a man is justified by faith, without works of law.
content_old: 28 for we reckon that a man is justified by faith, without works of law.

content: 29 Is God the God of Jews only? is he not of the nations also? Yea, of nations also:
content_old: 29 Is God the God of Jews only? is he not of the nations also? Yea, of nations also:

content: 30 since indeed it is one God who shall justify the circumcision on the principle of faith, and uncircumcision by faith.
content_old: 30 since indeed it is one God who shall justify the circumcision on the principle of faith, and uncircumcision by faith.

content: 1 What shall we say then that Abraham our father according to flesh has found?
content_old: 1 What shall we say then that Abraham our father according to flesh has found?

content: 2 For if Abraham has been justified on the principle of works, he has whereof to boast: but not before God;
content_old: 2 For if Abraham has been justified on the principle of works, he has whereof to boast: but not before God;

content: 3 for what does the scripture say? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness.
content_old: 3 for what does the scripture say? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness.

content: 4 Now to him that works the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but of debt:
content_old: 4 Now to him that works the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but of debt:

content: 5 but to him who does not work, but believes on him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness.
content_old: 5 but to him who does not work, but believes on him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness.

content: 6 Even as David also declares the blessedness of the man to whom God reckons righteousness without works:
content_old: 6 Even as David also declares the blessedness of the man to whom God reckons righteousness without works:

content: 7 Blessed they whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven, and whose sins have been covered:
content_old: 7 Blessed they whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven, and whose sins have been covered:

content: 8 blessed the man to whom the Lord shall not at all reckon sin.
content_old: 8 blessed the man to whom the Lord shall not at all reckon sin.

content: 9 Does this blessedness then rest on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision? For we say that faith has been reckoned to Abraham as righteousness.
content_old: 9 Does this blessedness then rest on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision? For we say that faith has been reckoned to Abraham as righteousness.

content: 10 How then has it been reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.
content_old: 10 How then has it been reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

content: 11 And he received the sign of circumcision as seal of the righteousness of faith which he had being in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all them that believe being in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned to them also;
content_old: 11 And he received the sign of circumcision as seal of the righteousness of faith which he had being in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all them that believe being in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned to them also;

content: 12 and father of circumcision, not only to those who are of the circumcision, but to those also who walk in the steps of the faith, during uncircumcision, of our father Abraham.
content_old: 12 and father of circumcision, not only to those who are of the circumcision, but to those also who walk in the steps of the faith, during uncircumcision, of our father Abraham.

content: 13 For it was not by law that the promise was to Abraham, or to his seed, that he should be heir of the world, but by righteousness of faith.
content_old: 13 For it was not by law that the promise was to Abraham, or to his seed, that he should be heir of the world, but by righteousness of faith.

content: 14 For if they which are of law be heirs, faith is made vain, and the promise made of no effect.
content_old: 14 For if they which are of law be heirs, faith is made vain, and the promise made of no effect.

content: 15 For law works wrath; but where no law is neither is there transgression.
content_old: 15 For law works wrath; but where no law is neither is there transgression.

content: 16 Therefore it is on the principle of faith, that it might be according to grace, in order to the promise being sure to all the seed, not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of Abraham’s faith, who is father of us all,
content_old: 16 Therefore it is on the principle of faith, that it might be according to grace, in order to the promise being sure to all the seed, not to that only which is of the law, but to that also which is of Abraham’s faith, who is father of us all,

content: 17 (according as it is written, I have made thee father of many nations,) before the God whom he believed, who quickens the dead, and calls the things which be not as being;
content_old: 17 (according as it is written, I have made thee father of many nations,) before the God whom he believed, who quickens the dead, and calls the things which be not as being;

content: 18 who against hope believed in hope to his becoming father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be:
content_old: 18 who against hope believed in hope to his becoming father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be:

content: 19 and not being weak in faith, he considered not his own body already become dead, being about a hundred years old, and the deadening of Sarah’s womb,
content_old: 19 and not being weak in faith, he considered not his own body already become dead, being about a hundred years old, and the deadening of Sarah’s womb,

content: 20 and hesitated not at the promise of God through unbelief; but found strength in faith, giving glory to God;
content_old: 20 and hesitated not at the promise of God through unbelief; but found strength in faith, giving glory to God;

content: 21 and being fully persuaded that what he has promised he is able also to do;
content_old: 21 and being fully persuaded that what he has promised he is able also to do;

content: 22 wherefore also it was reckoned to him as righteousness.
content_old: 22 wherefore also it was reckoned to him as righteousness.

content: 23 Now it was not written on his account alone that it was reckoned to him,
content_old: 23 Now it was not written on his account alone that it was reckoned to him,

content: 24 but on ours also, to whom, believing on him who has raised from among the dead Jesus our Lord,
content_old: 24 but on ours also, to whom, believing on him who has raised from among the dead Jesus our Lord,

content: 1 Therefore having been justified on the principle of faith, we have peace towards God through our Lord Jesus Christ;
content_old: 1 Therefore having been justified on the principle of faith, we have peace towards God through our Lord Jesus Christ;

content: 2 by whom we have also access by faith into this favour in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.
content_old: 2 by whom we have also access by faith into this favour in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.

content: 3 And not only that, but we also boast in tribulations, knowing that tribulation works endurance;
content_old: 3 And not only that, but we also boast in tribulations, knowing that tribulation works endurance;

content: 4 and endurance, experience; and experience, hope;
content_old: 4 and endurance, experience; and experience, hope;

content: 5 and hope does not make ashamed, because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Spirit which has been given to us:
content_old: 5 and hope does not make ashamed, because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Spirit which has been given to us:

content: 6 for we being still without strength, in the due time Christ has died for the ungodly.
content_old: 6 for we being still without strength, in the due time Christ has died for the ungodly.

content: 7 For scarcely for the just man will one die, for perhaps for the good man some one might also dare to die;
content_old: 7 For scarcely for the just man will one die, for perhaps for the good man some one might also dare to die;

content: 8 but God commends his love to us, in that, we being still sinners, Christ has died for us.
content_old: 8 but God commends his love to us, in that, we being still sinners, Christ has died for us.

content: 9 Much rather therefore, having been now justified in the power of his blood, we shall be saved by him from wrath.
content_old: 9 Much rather therefore, having been now justified in the power of his blood, we shall be saved by him from wrath.

content: 10 For if, being enemies, we have been reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much rather, having been reconciled, we shall be saved in the power of his life.
content_old: 10 For if, being enemies, we have been reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much rather, having been reconciled, we shall be saved in the power of his life.

content: 11 And not only that, but we are making our boast in God, through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom now we have received the reconciliation.
content_old: 11 And not only that, but we are making our boast in God, through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom now we have received the reconciliation.

content: 12 For this cause, even as by one man sin entered into the world, and by sin death; and thus death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:
content_old: 12 For this cause, even as by one man sin entered into the world, and by sin death; and thus death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned:

content: 13 (for until law sin was in the world; but sin is not put to account when there is no law;
content_old: 13 (for until law sin was in the world; but sin is not put to account when there is no law;

content: 14 but death reigned from Adam until Moses, even upon those who had not sinned in the likeness of Adam’s transgression, who is the figure of him to come.
content_old: 14 but death reigned from Adam until Moses, even upon those who had not sinned in the likeness of Adam’s transgression, who is the figure of him to come.

content: 15 But shall not the act of favour be as the offence? For if by the offence of one the many have died, much rather has the grace of God, and the free gift in grace, which is by the one man Jesus Christ, abounded unto the many.
content_old: 15 But shall not the act of favour be as the offence? For if by the offence of one the many have died, much rather has the grace of God, and the free gift in grace, which is by the one man Jesus Christ, abounded unto the many.

content: 16 And shall not as by one that has sinned be the gift? For the judgment was of one to condemnation, but the act of favour, of many offences unto justification.
content_old: 16 And shall not as by one that has sinned be the gift? For the judgment was of one to condemnation, but the act of favour, of many offences unto justification.

content: 17 For if by the offence of the one death reigned by the one, much rather shall those who receive the abundance of grace, and of the free gift of righteousness, reign in life by the one Jesus Christ:)
content_old: 17 For if by the offence of the one death reigned by the one, much rather shall those who receive the abundance of grace, and of the free gift of righteousness, reign in life by the one Jesus Christ:)

content: 18 so then as it was by one offence towards all men to condemnation, so by one righteousness towards all men for justification of life.
content_old: 18 so then as it was by one offence towards all men to condemnation, so by one righteousness towards all men for justification of life.

content: 19 For as indeed by the disobedience of the one man the many have been constituted sinners, so also by the obedience of the one the many will be constituted righteous.
content_old: 19 For as indeed by the disobedience of the one man the many have been constituted sinners, so also by the obedience of the one the many will be constituted righteous.

content: 20 But law came in, in order that the offence might abound; but where sin abounded grace has overabounded,
content_old: 20 But law came in, in order that the offence might abound; but where sin abounded grace has overabounded,

content: 1 What then shall we say? Should we continue in sin that grace may abound?
content_old: 1 What then shall we say? Should we continue in sin that grace may abound?

content: 2 Far be the thought. We who have died to sin, how shall we still live in it?
content_old: 2 Far be the thought. We who have died to sin, how shall we still live in it?

content: 3 Are you ignorant that we, as many as have been baptised unto Christ Jesus, have been baptised unto his death?
content_old: 3 Are you ignorant that we, as many as have been baptised unto Christ Jesus, have been baptised unto his death?

content: 4 We have been buried therefore with him by baptism unto death, in order that, even as Christ has been raised up from among the dead by the glory of the Father, so we also should walk in newness of life.
content_old: 4 We have been buried therefore with him by baptism unto death, in order that, even as Christ has been raised up from among the dead by the glory of the Father, so we also should walk in newness of life.

content: 5 For if we are become identified with him in the likeness of his death, so also we shall be of his resurrection;
content_old: 5 For if we are become identified with him in the likeness of his death, so also we shall be of his resurrection;

content: 6 knowing this, that our old man has been crucified with him, that the body of sin might be annulled, that we should no longer serve sin.
content_old: 6 knowing this, that our old man has been crucified with him, that the body of sin might be annulled, that we should no longer serve sin.

content: 7 For he that has died is justified from sin.
content_old: 7 For he that has died is justified from sin.

content: 8 Now if we have died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,
content_old: 8 Now if we have died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,

content: 9 knowing that Christ having been raised up from among the dead dies no more: death has dominion over him no more.
content_old: 9 knowing that Christ having been raised up from among the dead dies no more: death has dominion over him no more.

content: 10 For in that he has died, he has died to sin once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God.
content_old: 10 For in that he has died, he has died to sin once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God.

content: 11 So also ye, reckon yourselves dead to sin and alive to God in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 11 So also ye, reckon yourselves dead to sin and alive to God in Christ Jesus.

content: 12 Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body to obey its lusts.
content_old: 12 Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body to obey its lusts.

content: 13 Neither yield your members instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but yield yourselves to God as alive from among the dead, and your members instruments of righteousness to God.
content_old: 13 Neither yield your members instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but yield yourselves to God as alive from among the dead, and your members instruments of righteousness to God.

content: 14 For sin shall not have dominion over you, for ye are not under law but under grace.
content_old: 14 For sin shall not have dominion over you, for ye are not under law but under grace.

content: 15 What then? should we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Far be the thought.
content_old: 15 What then? should we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Far be the thought.

content: 16 Know ye not that to whom ye yield yourselves bondmen for obedience, ye are bondmen to him whom ye obey, whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?
content_old: 16 Know ye not that to whom ye yield yourselves bondmen for obedience, ye are bondmen to him whom ye obey, whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness?

content: 17 But thanks be to God, that ye were bondmen of sin, but have obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which ye were instructed.
content_old: 17 But thanks be to God, that ye were bondmen of sin, but have obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which ye were instructed.

content: 18 Now, having got your freedom from sin, ye have become bondmen to righteousness.
content_old: 18 Now, having got your freedom from sin, ye have become bondmen to righteousness.

content: 19 I speak humanly on account of the weakness of your flesh. For even as ye have yielded your members in bondage to uncleanness and to lawlessness unto lawlessness, so now yield your members in bondage to righteousness unto holiness.
content_old: 19 I speak humanly on account of the weakness of your flesh. For even as ye have yielded your members in bondage to uncleanness and to lawlessness unto lawlessness, so now yield your members in bondage to righteousness unto holiness.

content: 20 For when ye were bondmen of sin ye were free from righteousness.
content_old: 20 For when ye were bondmen of sin ye were free from righteousness.

content: 21 What fruit therefore had ye then in the things of which ye are now ashamed? for the end of them is death.
content_old: 21 What fruit therefore had ye then in the things of which ye are now ashamed? for the end of them is death.

content: 22 But now, having got your freedom from sin, and having become bondmen to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end eternal life.
content_old: 22 But now, having got your freedom from sin, and having become bondmen to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end eternal life.

content: 1 Are ye ignorant, brethren, (for I speak to those knowing law,) that law rules over a man as long as he lives?
content_old: 1 Are ye ignorant, brethren, (for I speak to those knowing law,) that law rules over a man as long as he lives?

content: 2 For the married woman is bound by law to her husband so long as he is alive; but if the husband should die, she is clear from the law of the husband:
content_old: 2 For the married woman is bound by law to her husband so long as he is alive; but if the husband should die, she is clear from the law of the husband:

content: 3 so then, the husband being alive, she shall be called an adulteress if she be to another man; but if the husband should die, she is free from the law, so as not to be an adulteress, though she be to another man.
content_old: 3 so then, the husband being alive, she shall be called an adulteress if she be to another man; but if the husband should die, she is free from the law, so as not to be an adulteress, though she be to another man.

content: 4 So that, my brethren, ye also have been made dead to the law by the body of the Christ, to be to another, who has been raised up from among the dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God.
content_old: 4 So that, my brethren, ye also have been made dead to the law by the body of the Christ, to be to another, who has been raised up from among the dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God.

content: 5 For when we were in the flesh the passions of sins, which were by the law, wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death;
content_old: 5 For when we were in the flesh the passions of sins, which were by the law, wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death;

content: 6 but now we are clear from the law, having died in that in which we were held, so that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in oldness of letter.
content_old: 6 but now we are clear from the law, having died in that in which we were held, so that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in oldness of letter.

content: 7 What shall we say then? is the law sin? Far be the thought. But I had not known sin, unless by law: for I had not had conscience also of lust unless the law had said, Thou shalt not lust;
content_old: 7 What shall we say then? is the law sin? Far be the thought. But I had not known sin, unless by law: for I had not had conscience also of lust unless the law had said, Thou shalt not lust;

content: 8 but sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, wrought in me every lust; for without law sin was dead.
content_old: 8 but sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, wrought in me every lust; for without law sin was dead.

content: 9 But I was alive without law once; but the commandment having come, sin revived, but I died.
content_old: 9 But I was alive without law once; but the commandment having come, sin revived, but I died.

content: 10 And the commandment, which was for life, was found, as to me, itself to be unto death:
content_old: 10 And the commandment, which was for life, was found, as to me, itself to be unto death:

content: 11 for sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.
content_old: 11 for sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew me.

content: 12 So that the law indeed is holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.
content_old: 12 So that the law indeed is holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good.

content: 13 Did then that which is good become death to me? Far be the thought. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death to me by that which is good; in order that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.
content_old: 13 Did then that which is good become death to me? Far be the thought. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death to me by that which is good; in order that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

content: 14 For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am fleshly, sold under sin.
content_old: 14 For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am fleshly, sold under sin.

content: 15 For that which I do, I do not own: for not what I will, this I do; but what I hate, this I practise.
content_old: 15 For that which I do, I do not own: for not what I will, this I do; but what I hate, this I practise.

content: 16 But if what I do not will, this I practise, I consent to the law that it is right.
content_old: 16 But if what I do not will, this I practise, I consent to the law that it is right.

content: 17 Now then it is no longer I that do it, but the sin that dwells in me.
content_old: 17 Now then it is no longer I that do it, but the sin that dwells in me.

content: 18 For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, good does not dwell: for to will is there with me, but to do right I find not.
content_old: 18 For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, good does not dwell: for to will is there with me, but to do right I find not.

content: 19 For I do not practise the good that I will; but the evil I do not will, that I do.
content_old: 19 For I do not practise the good that I will; but the evil I do not will, that I do.

content: 20 But if what I do not will, this I practise, it is no longer I that do it, but the sin that dwells in me.
content_old: 20 But if what I do not will, this I practise, it is no longer I that do it, but the sin that dwells in me.

content: 21 I find then the law upon me who will to practise what is right, that with me evil is there.
content_old: 21 I find then the law upon me who will to practise what is right, that with me evil is there.

content: 22 For I delight in the law of God according to the inward man:
content_old: 22 For I delight in the law of God according to the inward man:

content: 23 but I see another law in my members, warring in opposition to the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which exists in my members.
content_old: 23 but I see another law in my members, warring in opposition to the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which exists in my members.

content: 24 O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me out of this body of death?
content_old: 24 O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me out of this body of death?

content: 1 There is then now no condemnation to those in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 1 There is then now no condemnation to those in Christ Jesus.

content: 2 For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and of death.
content_old: 2 For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and of death.

content: 3 For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God, having sent his own Son, in likeness of flesh of sin, and for sin, has condemned sin in the flesh,
content_old: 3 For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God, having sent his own Son, in likeness of flesh of sin, and for sin, has condemned sin in the flesh,

content: 4 in order that the righteous requirement of the law should be fulfilled in us, who do not walk according to flesh but according to Spirit.
content_old: 4 in order that the righteous requirement of the law should be fulfilled in us, who do not walk according to flesh but according to Spirit.

content: 5 For they that are according to flesh mind the things of the flesh; and they that are according to Spirit, the things of the Spirit.
content_old: 5 For they that are according to flesh mind the things of the flesh; and they that are according to Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

content: 6 For the mind of the flesh is death; but the mind of the Spirit life and peace.
content_old: 6 For the mind of the flesh is death; but the mind of the Spirit life and peace.

content: 7 Because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God; for neither indeed can it be:
content_old: 7 Because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God; for neither indeed can it be:

content: 8 and they that are in flesh cannot please God.
content_old: 8 and they that are in flesh cannot please God.

content: 9 But ye are not in flesh but in Spirit, if indeed God’s Spirit dwell in you; but if any one has not the Spirit of Christ he is not of him:
content_old: 9 But ye are not in flesh but in Spirit, if indeed God’s Spirit dwell in you; but if any one has not the Spirit of Christ he is not of him:

content: 10 but if Christ be in you, the body is dead on account of sin, but the Spirit life on account of righteousness.
content_old: 10 but if Christ be in you, the body is dead on account of sin, but the Spirit life on account of righteousness.

content: 11 But if the Spirit of him that has raised up Jesus from among the dead dwell in you, he that has raised up Christ from among the dead shall quicken your mortal bodies also on account of his Spirit which dwells in you.
content_old: 11 But if the Spirit of him that has raised up Jesus from among the dead dwell in you, he that has raised up Christ from among the dead shall quicken your mortal bodies also on account of his Spirit which dwells in you.

content: 12 So then, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live according to flesh;
content_old: 12 So then, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live according to flesh;

content: 13 for if ye live according to flesh, ye are about to die; but if, by the Spirit, ye put to death the deeds of the body, ye shall live:
content_old: 13 for if ye live according to flesh, ye are about to die; but if, by the Spirit, ye put to death the deeds of the body, ye shall live:

content: 14 for as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.
content_old: 14 for as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.

content: 15 For ye have not received a spirit of bondage again for fear, but ye have received a spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.
content_old: 15 For ye have not received a spirit of bondage again for fear, but ye have received a spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.

content: 16 The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit, that we are children of God.
content_old: 16 The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit, that we are children of God.

content: 17 And if children, heirs also: heirs of God, and Christ’s joint heirs; if indeed we suffer with him, that we may also be glorified with him.
content_old: 17 And if children, heirs also: heirs of God, and Christ’s joint heirs; if indeed we suffer with him, that we may also be glorified with him.

content: 18 For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the coming glory to be revealed to us.
content_old: 18 For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the coming glory to be revealed to us.

content: 19 For the anxious looking out of the creature expects the revelation of the sons of God:
content_old: 19 For the anxious looking out of the creature expects the revelation of the sons of God:

content: 20 for the creature has been made subject to vanity, not of its will, but by reason of him who has subjected the same, in hope
content_old: 20 for the creature has been made subject to vanity, not of its will, but by reason of him who has subjected the same, in hope

content: 21 that the creature itself also shall be set free from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.
content_old: 21 that the creature itself also shall be set free from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

content: 22 For we know that the whole creation groans together and travails in pain together until now.
content_old: 22 For we know that the whole creation groans together and travails in pain together until now.

content: 23 And not only that, but even we ourselves, who have the first-fruits of the Spirit, we also ourselves groan in ourselves, awaiting adoption, that is the redemption of our body.
content_old: 23 And not only that, but even we ourselves, who have the first-fruits of the Spirit, we also ourselves groan in ourselves, awaiting adoption, that is the redemption of our body.

content: 24 For we have been saved in hope; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope?
content_old: 24 For we have been saved in hope; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope?

content: 25 But if what we see not we hope, we expect in patience.
content_old: 25 But if what we see not we hope, we expect in patience.

content: 26 And in like manner the Spirit joins also its help to our weakness; for we do not know what we should pray for as is fitting, but the Spirit itself makes intercession with groanings which cannot be uttered.
content_old: 26 And in like manner the Spirit joins also its help to our weakness; for we do not know what we should pray for as is fitting, but the Spirit itself makes intercession with groanings which cannot be uttered.

content: 27 But he who searches the hearts knows what is the mind of the Spirit, because he intercedes for saints according to God.
content_old: 27 But he who searches the hearts knows what is the mind of the Spirit, because he intercedes for saints according to God.

content: 28 But we do know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to purpose.
content_old: 28 But we do know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to purpose.

content: 29 Because whom he has foreknown, he has also predestinated to be conformed to the image of his Son, so that he should be the firstborn among many brethren.
content_old: 29 Because whom he has foreknown, he has also predestinated to be conformed to the image of his Son, so that he should be the firstborn among many brethren.

content: 30 But whom he has predestinated, these also he has called; and whom he has called, these also he has justified; but whom he has justified, these also he has glorified.
content_old: 30 But whom he has predestinated, these also he has called; and whom he has called, these also he has justified; but whom he has justified, these also he has glorified.

content: 31 What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who against us?
content_old: 31 What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who against us?

content: 32 He who, yea, has not spared his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also with him grant us all things?
content_old: 32 He who, yea, has not spared his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also with him grant us all things?

content: 33 Who shall bring an accusation against God’s elect? It is God who justifies:
content_old: 33 Who shall bring an accusation against God’s elect? It is God who justifies:

content: 34 who is he that condemns? It is Christ who has died, but rather has been also raised up; who is also at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us.
content_old: 34 who is he that condemns? It is Christ who has died, but rather has been also raised up; who is also at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us.

content: 35 Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? tribulation or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword?
content_old: 35 Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? tribulation or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword?

content: 36 According as it is written, For thy sake we are put to death all the day long; we have been reckoned as sheep for slaughter.
content_old: 36 According as it is written, For thy sake we are put to death all the day long; we have been reckoned as sheep for slaughter.

content: 37 But in all these things we more than conquer through him that has loved us.
content_old: 37 But in all these things we more than conquer through him that has loved us.

content: 38 For I am persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,
content_old: 38 For I am persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,

content: 1 I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit,
content_old: 1 I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit,

content: 2 that I have great grief and uninterrupted pain in my heart,
content_old: 2 that I have great grief and uninterrupted pain in my heart,

content: 3 for I have wished, I myself, to be a curse from the Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen, according to flesh;
content_old: 3 for I have wished, I myself, to be a curse from the Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen, according to flesh;

content: 4 who are Israelites; whose is the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the law-giving, and the service, and the promises;
content_old: 4 who are Israelites; whose is the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the law-giving, and the service, and the promises;

content: 5 whose are the fathers; and of whom, as according to flesh, is the Christ, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.
content_old: 5 whose are the fathers; and of whom, as according to flesh, is the Christ, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.

content: 6 Not however as though the word of God had failed; for not all are Israel which are of Israel;
content_old: 6 Not however as though the word of God had failed; for not all are Israel which are of Israel;

content: 7 nor because they are seed of Abraham are all children: but, In Isaac shall a seed be called to thee.
content_old: 7 nor because they are seed of Abraham are all children: but, In Isaac shall a seed be called to thee.

content: 8 That is, they that are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned as seed.
content_old: 8 That is, they that are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned as seed.

content: 9 For this word is of promise, According to this time I will come, and there shall be a son to Sarah.
content_old: 9 For this word is of promise, According to this time I will come, and there shall be a son to Sarah.

content: 10 And not only that, but Rebecca having conceived by one, Isaac our father,
content_old: 10 And not only that, but Rebecca having conceived by one, Isaac our father,

content: 11 the children indeed being not yet born, or having done anything good or worthless (that the purpose of God according to election might abide, not of works, but of him that calls),
content_old: 11 the children indeed being not yet born, or having done anything good or worthless (that the purpose of God according to election might abide, not of works, but of him that calls),

content: 12 it was said to her, The greater shall serve the less:
content_old: 12 it was said to her, The greater shall serve the less:

content: 13 according as it is written, I have loved Jacob, and I have hated Esau.
content_old: 13 according as it is written, I have loved Jacob, and I have hated Esau.

content: 14 What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? Far be the thought.
content_old: 14 What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? Far be the thought.

content: 15 For he says to Moses, I will shew mercy to whom I will shew mercy, and I will feel compassion for whom I will feel compassion.
content_old: 15 For he says to Moses, I will shew mercy to whom I will shew mercy, and I will feel compassion for whom I will feel compassion.

content: 16 So then it is not of him that wills, nor of him that runs, but of God that shews mercy.
content_old: 16 So then it is not of him that wills, nor of him that runs, but of God that shews mercy.

content: 17 For the scripture says to Pharaoh, For this very thing I have raised thee up from amongst men, that I might thus shew in thee my power, and so that my name should be declared in all the earth.
content_old: 17 For the scripture says to Pharaoh, For this very thing I have raised thee up from amongst men, that I might thus shew in thee my power, and so that my name should be declared in all the earth.

content: 18 So then, to whom he will he shews mercy, and whom he will he hardens.
content_old: 18 So then, to whom he will he shews mercy, and whom he will he hardens.

content: 19 Thou wilt say to me then, Why does he yet find fault? for who resists his purpose?
content_old: 19 Thou wilt say to me then, Why does he yet find fault? for who resists his purpose?

content: 20 Aye, but thou, O man, who art thou that answerest again to God? Shall the thing formed say to him that has formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?
content_old: 20 Aye, but thou, O man, who art thou that answerest again to God? Shall the thing formed say to him that has formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?

content: 21 Or has not the potter authority over the clay, out of the same lump to make one vessel to honour, and another to dishonour?
content_old: 21 Or has not the potter authority over the clay, out of the same lump to make one vessel to honour, and another to dishonour?

content: 22 And if God, minded to shew his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much long-suffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction;
content_old: 22 And if God, minded to shew his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much long-suffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction;

content: 23 and that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he had before prepared for glory,
content_old: 23 and that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he had before prepared for glory,

content: 24 us, whom he has also called, not only from amongst the Jews, but also from amongst the nations?
content_old: 24 us, whom he has also called, not only from amongst the Jews, but also from amongst the nations?

content: 25 As he says also in Hosea, I will call not-my-people My people; and the-not-beloved Beloved.
content_old: 25 As he says also in Hosea, I will call not-my-people My people; and the-not-beloved Beloved.

content: 26 And it shall be, in the place where it was said to them, Ye are not my people, there shall they be called Sons of the living God.
content_old: 26 And it shall be, in the place where it was said to them, Ye are not my people, there shall they be called Sons of the living God.

content: 27 But Esaias cries concerning Israel, Should the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved:
content_old: 27 But Esaias cries concerning Israel, Should the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved:

content: 28 for he is bringing the matter to an end, and (cutting it short in righteousness; because) a cutting short of the matter will the Lord accomplish upon the earth.
content_old: 28 for he is bringing the matter to an end, and (cutting it short in righteousness; because) a cutting short of the matter will the Lord accomplish upon the earth.

content: 29 And according as Esaias said before, Unless the Lord of hosts had left us a seed, we had been as Sodom, and made like even as Gomorrha.
content_old: 29 And according as Esaias said before, Unless the Lord of hosts had left us a seed, we had been as Sodom, and made like even as Gomorrha.

content: 30 What then shall we say? That they of the nations, who did not follow after righteousness, have attained righteousness, but the righteousness that is on the principle of faith.
content_old: 30 What then shall we say? That they of the nations, who did not follow after righteousness, have attained righteousness, but the righteousness that is on the principle of faith.

content: 31 But Israel, pursuing after a law of righteousness, has not attained to that law.
content_old: 31 But Israel, pursuing after a law of righteousness, has not attained to that law.

content: 32 Wherefore? Because it was not on the principle of faith, but as of works. They have stumbled at the stumblingstone,
content_old: 32 Wherefore? Because it was not on the principle of faith, but as of works. They have stumbled at the stumblingstone,

content: 1 Brethren, the delight of my own heart and my supplication which I address to God for them is for salvation.
content_old: 1 Brethren, the delight of my own heart and my supplication which I address to God for them is for salvation.

content: 2 For I bear them witness that they have zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
content_old: 2 For I bear them witness that they have zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

content: 3 For they, being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God.
content_old: 3 For they, being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God.

content: 4 For Christ is the end of law for righteousness to every one that believes.
content_old: 4 For Christ is the end of law for righteousness to every one that believes.

content: 5 For Moses lays down in writing the righteousness which is of the law, The man who has practised those things shall live by them.
content_old: 5 For Moses lays down in writing the righteousness which is of the law, The man who has practised those things shall live by them.

content: 6 But the righteousness of faith speaks thus: Do not say in thine heart, Who shall ascend to the heavens? that is, to bring Christ down;
content_old: 6 But the righteousness of faith speaks thus: Do not say in thine heart, Who shall ascend to the heavens? that is, to bring Christ down;

content: 7 or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring up Christ from among the dead.
content_old: 7 or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring up Christ from among the dead.

content: 8 But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach:
content_old: 8 But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach:

content: 9 that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth Jesus as Lord, and shalt believe in thine heart that God has raised him from among the dead, thou shalt be saved.
content_old: 9 that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth Jesus as Lord, and shalt believe in thine heart that God has raised him from among the dead, thou shalt be saved.

content: 10 For with the heart is believed to righteousness; and with the mouth confession made to salvation.
content_old: 10 For with the heart is believed to righteousness; and with the mouth confession made to salvation.

content: 11 For the scripture says, No one believing on him shall be ashamed.
content_old: 11 For the scripture says, No one believing on him shall be ashamed.

content: 12 For there is no difference of Jew and Greek; for the same Lord of all is rich towards all that call upon him.
content_old: 12 For there is no difference of Jew and Greek; for the same Lord of all is rich towards all that call upon him.

content: 13 For every one whosoever, who shall call on the name of the Lord, shall be saved.
content_old: 13 For every one whosoever, who shall call on the name of the Lord, shall be saved.

content: 14 How then shall they call upon him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe on him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without one who preaches?
content_old: 14 How then shall they call upon him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe on him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without one who preaches?

content: 15 and how shall they preach unless they have been sent? according as it is written, How beautiful the feet of them that announce glad tidings of peace, of them that announce glad tidings of good things!
content_old: 15 and how shall they preach unless they have been sent? according as it is written, How beautiful the feet of them that announce glad tidings of peace, of them that announce glad tidings of good things!

content: 16 But they have not all obeyed the glad tidings. For Esaias says, Lord, who has believed our report?
content_old: 16 But they have not all obeyed the glad tidings. For Esaias says, Lord, who has believed our report?

content: 17 So faith then is by a report, but the report by God’s word.
content_old: 17 So faith then is by a report, but the report by God’s word.

content: 18 But I say, Have they not heard? Yea, surely, Their voice has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the extremities of the habitable world.
content_old: 18 But I say, Have they not heard? Yea, surely, Their voice has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the extremities of the habitable world.

content: 19 But I say, Has not Israel known? First, Moses says, I will provoke you to jealousy through them that are not a nation: through a nation without understanding I will anger you.
content_old: 19 But I say, Has not Israel known? First, Moses says, I will provoke you to jealousy through them that are not a nation: through a nation without understanding I will anger you.

content: 20 But Esaias is very bold, and says, I have been found by those not seeking me; I have become manifest to those not inquiring after me.
content_old: 20 But Esaias is very bold, and says, I have been found by those not seeking me; I have become manifest to those not inquiring after me.

content: 1 I say then, Has God cast away his people? Far be the thought. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
content_old: 1 I say then, Has God cast away his people? Far be the thought. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

content: 2 God has not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know ye not what the scripture says in the history of Elias, how he pleads with God against Israel?
content_old: 2 God has not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know ye not what the scripture says in the history of Elias, how he pleads with God against Israel?

content: 3 Lord, they have killed thy prophets, they have dug down thine altars; and I have been left alone, and they seek my life.
content_old: 3 Lord, they have killed thy prophets, they have dug down thine altars; and I have been left alone, and they seek my life.

content: 4 But what says the divine answer to him? I have left to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed knee to Baal.
content_old: 4 But what says the divine answer to him? I have left to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed knee to Baal.

content: 5 Thus, then, in the present time also there has been a remnant according to election of grace.
content_old: 5 Thus, then, in the present time also there has been a remnant according to election of grace.

content: 6 But if by grace, no longer of works: since otherwise grace is no more grace.
content_old: 6 But if by grace, no longer of works: since otherwise grace is no more grace.

content: 7 What is it then? What Israel seeks for, that he has not obtained; but the election has obtained, and the rest have been blinded,
content_old: 7 What is it then? What Israel seeks for, that he has not obtained; but the election has obtained, and the rest have been blinded,

content: 8 according as it is written, God has given to them a spirit of slumber, eyes not to see, and ears not to hear, unto this day.
content_old: 8 according as it is written, God has given to them a spirit of slumber, eyes not to see, and ears not to hear, unto this day.

content: 9 And David says, Let their table be for a snare, and for a gin, and for a fall-trap, and for a recompense to them:
content_old: 9 And David says, Let their table be for a snare, and for a gin, and for a fall-trap, and for a recompense to them:

content: 10 let their eyes be darkened not to see, and bow down their back alway.
content_old: 10 let their eyes be darkened not to see, and bow down their back alway.

content: 11 I say then, Have they stumbled in order that they might fall? Far be the thought: but by their fall there is salvation to the nations to provoke them to jealousy.
content_old: 11 I say then, Have they stumbled in order that they might fall? Far be the thought: but by their fall there is salvation to the nations to provoke them to jealousy.

content: 12 But if their fall be the world’s wealth, and their loss the wealth of the nations, how much rather their fulness?
content_old: 12 But if their fall be the world’s wealth, and their loss the wealth of the nations, how much rather their fulness?

content: 13 For I speak to you, the nations, inasmuch as I am apostle of nations, I glorify my ministry;
content_old: 13 For I speak to you, the nations, inasmuch as I am apostle of nations, I glorify my ministry;

content: 14 if by any means I shall provoke to jealousy them which are my flesh, and shall save some from among them.
content_old: 14 if by any means I shall provoke to jealousy them which are my flesh, and shall save some from among them.

content: 15 For if their casting away be the world’s reconciliation, what their reception but life from among the dead?
content_old: 15 For if their casting away be the world’s reconciliation, what their reception but life from among the dead?

content: 16 Now if the first-fruit be holy, the lump also; and if the root be holy, the branches also.
content_old: 16 Now if the first-fruit be holy, the lump also; and if the root be holy, the branches also.

content: 17 Now if some of the branches have been broken out, and thou, being a wild olive tree, hast been grafted in amongst them, and hast become a fellow-partaker of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree,
content_old: 17 Now if some of the branches have been broken out, and thou, being a wild olive tree, hast been grafted in amongst them, and hast become a fellow-partaker of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree,

content: 18 boast not against the branches; but if thou boast, it is not thou bearest the root, but the root thee.
content_old: 18 boast not against the branches; but if thou boast, it is not thou bearest the root, but the root thee.

content: 19 Thou wilt say then, The branches have been broken out in order that I might be grafted in.
content_old: 19 Thou wilt say then, The branches have been broken out in order that I might be grafted in.

content: 20 Right: they have been broken out through unbelief, and thou standest through faith. Be not high-minded, but fear:
content_old: 20 Right: they have been broken out through unbelief, and thou standest through faith. Be not high-minded, but fear:

content: 21 if God indeed has not spared the natural branches; lest it might be he spare not thee either.
content_old: 21 if God indeed has not spared the natural branches; lest it might be he spare not thee either.

content: 22 Behold then the goodness and severity of God: upon them who have fallen, severity; upon thee goodness of God, if thou shalt abide in goodness, since otherwise thou also wilt be cut away.
content_old: 22 Behold then the goodness and severity of God: upon them who have fallen, severity; upon thee goodness of God, if thou shalt abide in goodness, since otherwise thou also wilt be cut away.

content: 23 And they too, if they abide not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able again to graft them in.
content_old: 23 And they too, if they abide not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able again to graft them in.

content: 24 For if thou hast been cut out of the olive tree wild by nature, and, contrary to nature, hast been grafted into the good olive tree, how much rather shall they, who are according to nature be grafted into their own olive tree?
content_old: 24 For if thou hast been cut out of the olive tree wild by nature, and, contrary to nature, hast been grafted into the good olive tree, how much rather shall they, who are according to nature be grafted into their own olive tree?

content: 25 For I do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, of this mystery, that ye may not be wise in your own conceits, that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the nations be come in;
content_old: 25 For I do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, of this mystery, that ye may not be wise in your own conceits, that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the nations be come in;

content: 26 and so all Israel shall be saved. According as it is written, The deliverer shall come out of Zion; he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.
content_old: 26 and so all Israel shall be saved. According as it is written, The deliverer shall come out of Zion; he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

content: 27 And this is the covenant from me to them, when I shall have taken away their sins.
content_old: 27 And this is the covenant from me to them, when I shall have taken away their sins.

content: 28 As regards the glad tidings, they are enemies on your account; but as regards election, beloved on account of the fathers.
content_old: 28 As regards the glad tidings, they are enemies on your account; but as regards election, beloved on account of the fathers.

content: 29 For the gifts and the calling of God are not subject to repentance.
content_old: 29 For the gifts and the calling of God are not subject to repentance.

content: 30 For as indeed ye also once have not believed in God, but now have been objects of mercy through the unbelief of these;
content_old: 30 For as indeed ye also once have not believed in God, but now have been objects of mercy through the unbelief of these;

content: 31 so these also have now not believed in your mercy, in order that they also may be objects of mercy.
content_old: 31 so these also have now not believed in your mercy, in order that they also may be objects of mercy.

content: 32 For God hath shut up together all in unbelief, in order that he might shew mercy to all.
content_old: 32 For God hath shut up together all in unbelief, in order that he might shew mercy to all.

content: 33 O depth of riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable his judgments, and untraceable his ways!
content_old: 33 O depth of riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable his judgments, and untraceable his ways!

content: 34 For who has known the mind of the Lord, or who has been his counsellor?
content_old: 34 For who has known the mind of the Lord, or who has been his counsellor?

content: 35 or who has first given to him, and it shall be rendered to him?
content_old: 35 or who has first given to him, and it shall be rendered to him?

content: 1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the compassions of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your intelligent service.
content_old: 1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the compassions of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your intelligent service.

content: 2 And be not conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.
content_old: 2 And be not conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that ye may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.

content: 3 For I say, through the grace which has been given to me, to every one that is among you, not to have high thoughts above what he should think; but to think so as to be wise, as God has dealt to each a measure of faith.
